p: The cosmetic industry has extensively used essential oils for the formulation of perfumes due to their complex mixture of fragrant hydrocarbons such as ketones, ethers, esters, alcohols, aldehydes, and terpenoids [ 1]. From these natural products, terpenes such as volatile monoterpenes, sesquiterpenes, and diterpenes are the main constituents, which confer the specific odor to each essential oil [ 2].
